beans.description:
$Id$
This adaptor does the following...
* reads xml from stdin * validates the xml * writes to stdout
Validation failures cause the adaptor to fail. It is designed to show how to use the run configuration. This can be used to restart on failure and to perform scheduled stops, starts and restarts using Cron Expressions.
See quartz documentation for cron expression format (http://www.opensymphony.com/quartz)
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringApplication -config runconfig.xml -bean Adaptor
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar
Once it is running it will wait for command line input
type something like this...
<data>hello</data>
...and you should see it echo-ed
type something which is not an xml doc with a element called data and the validation exception will be thrown and the adaptor will fail (because this example has no exception capture defined).
